snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg referenced an obscure 11th-century Danish ruler when he said that he did not support the use of sea walls to protect New York City from storms.
abstract: New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg invokes obscure medieval monarch King Canute in saying he does not support use of sea walls to protect city from storms; story says that King Canute was unable to stop the tides and declared that as proof that only God could tame forces of nature.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg referenced an obscure 11th-century Danish ruler when he said that he did not support the use of sea walls to protect New York City from storms.

headline.seo: Bloomberg Rejects Sea Walls, Citing Tale of King Canute
headline.main: A King, Like the Mayor, Can’t Hold Back the Seas
headline.print_headline: A King, Like the Mayor, Can’t Hold Back the Seas
